alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued December 19 at 1:41PM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Extremely cold conditions will persist for nearly 36 hours. Snow and blowing snow are also possible Wednesday night causing travel to be very hazardous with these conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
